pages.text: Beam Spiltters can split a particle beam into two. Each new beam will have half the pu/t of the original (rounded down to the nearest pu).
Beam Spiltters are constructed the same as $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/beam_diverter)beam diverters$(/l) except they must have exactly two output beam ports. Example above.

pages.title: Operation
pages.text: To start the beam splitter just give the controller a redstone signal. A beam splitter functions the same as any other $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/general#operation)accelerator$(/l) requiring power and coolant. $(br2)$(l)Currently beam port switching is not available for beam splitters, so must be done manually.$()

pages.title: Particle Energy
pages.text: The same rules as $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/beam_diverter#energy)beam diverters$(/l) applies. Straight through beams get no energy loss while bent beams do.
